meanings.definition: Relating to the study or history of books.
meanings.sent1: The bibliographical research paper focused on the history of printing.
meanings.sent2: The bibliographical section of the library contains books about book history.
meanings.sent3: The bibliographical detective solved the mystery of the missing manuscripts.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a bibliographical treasure trove, filled with knowledge of ancient texts.
meanings.sent5: The bibliographical journey through time revealed the evolution of written communication.

meanings.definition: Providing information about books or other written works.
meanings.sent1: The bibliographical catalog listed all the available books in the store.
meanings.sent2: The bibliographical website offers detailed summaries of classic novels.
meanings.sent3: The bibliographical tour guide shared fascinating facts about the library's collection.
meanings.sent4: His memory was like a bibliographical database, storing details of every book he read.
meanings.sent5: The bibliographical map guided readers through the literary landscape with ease.
